definition: to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous

sentences.english: The officer, who refused to give his name, said Fang was on his way to the airport.
sentences.chinese: 该不愿透露姓名的警察表明方滨兴正在赶往机场。

sentences.english: Rescue workers rushed to the site.
sentences.chinese: 营救人员赶往雪崩地点。

sentences.english: So I made the four-hour trip from Zaragoza to Madrid.
sentences.chinese: 于是我花了四个小时从萨拉戈萨赶往马德里。

sentences.english: Hu Xuebing is on his way to the county town. He needs to sell his tofu at the morning market.
sentences.chinese: 胡学兵正赶往县城，他要在早市上卖掉今天的豆腐。

sentences.english: China's railway minister, Sheng Guangzu, was reported to have rushed to the scene.
sentences.chinese: 据报道，中国铁道部部长盛光祖已经火速赶往现场。

sentences.english: Of passengers breakfast, Xing-ice has led the passengers rushed to the airport.
sentences.chinese: 安排旅客吃完早餐，陈星冰又带领旅客赶往机场。

sentences.english: I rushed to the squadron fire officers and soldiers rushed to the scene and started a fire fight.
sentences.chinese: 我中队消防官兵火速赶往现场并展开了火灾扑救。

sentences.english: Allow that concise crash, and immediately rushed to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 允儿得悉简洁撞车，立即赶往医院。

sentences.english: After getting away from pursuing troops, I fast rush via into Wu to go properly main cool Lun location.
sentences.chinese: 摆脱追兵后，我迅速的赶往亡灵法师酷伦处。

sentences.english: When he set out for the market he forgot to bring it along.
sentences.chinese: 可当他赶往市集时，却忘了带量好的尺码。

sentences.english: Chen Zuo’er and division chief Zhang hurried to Beijing Capital Airport in the same day afternoon to meet Li and Xu.
sentences.chinese: 陈佐洱和张处长于当日下午赶往首都机场迎接。

sentences.english: But Jimmy, they are driving round to the house now as we speak.
sentences.chinese: 但我们说话这会他们肯定正驱车赶往我们家。

sentences.english: I land at 8.00 pm and head back home.
sentences.chinese: 晚上8点飞机降落后，我赶往家里。

sentences.english: There was an air of amusement as they approached the playground, which was afraid with banderole and balloons.
sentences.chinese: 赶往挂满了彩旗和气球的操场时，有一种节日的气氛。

sentences.english: Instantly he repented his life, put on his clothes in a hurry and rushed to the temple.
sentences.chinese: 他忽然深深忏悔，披衣而起，快马加鞭，赶往寺里。

sentences.english: The people rushed to cloud empty master xia town.
sentences.chinese: 众人赶往云空大师所在的霞流镇。

definition: that very night/through the night/for several nights in a row
to leave for/to proceed towards/to go
at top speed/at a tremendous lick
to go on a journey/to leave
to return to/to come (or go) back
to go straight to/to make a beeline for
